text:
This bug is for tracking the problem of slow rendering
on Mac OS X Tiger.  The basic issue is summed up in the 
following Apple java-developer links:

http://lists.apple.com/archives/java-dev/2005/May/msg00498.html
http://lists.apple.com/archives/Java-dev/2005/Jul/msg00009.html
http://lists.apple.com/archives/java-dev/2005/Aug/msg00381.html

   The short summary is that if you ever gain access to
the underlaying data array from a BufferedImage than all
Graphics2D calls to that BufferedImage will involve copying
the entire BufferedImage back and forth between main memory
and the GPU.

   I will attach a patch (really a new file) that attempts to
work around this in the worst and most common case.
creator: deweese@apache.org
deweese@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 16486
Replacement DynamicRenderer that avoids touching raster in BufferedImage

This patch provides a replacement DynamicRenderer that does not
leverage the more advanced image/buffer management used in the
Static Renderer and instead uses one or two simple BufferedImages
which is draws to directly.

Surprisingly performance seems a bit worse (or more 'jerky' with
this setup) on Windows.  However I am hopeful that primarily vector
content will be much faster with this renderer on mac os x.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 16487
The new DynamicRenderer complete (not as patch)

Same as previous attachment but as a single complete file instead of
a patch file.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 16533
New DynamicRenderer that uses 'simple' clip paths.

This may avoid some of the 'long' renders on Mac OS X, 
don't know.  It may be that Batik is just hitting this
drawing code too hard and it's having a hard time managing
memory on the Graphics Card.

creator: neumann@karto.baug.ethz.ch

Created attachment 16562
Yet another update to the DynamicRenderer

This updated version of the renderer seems to provide similar
performance on Windows as the original DynamicRenderer.
It might also solve the 'slow update' problem on Mac OS X.
It 'draws' the 'dirty' regions from the previous buffer into
the new buffer rather than copying them to a temp buffer
and then setting it into the new frame (the theory is that
this allows the Image data to stay on the Graphics Card).
creator: deweese@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 16570
background problem: background now rendered black

The new dynamic renderer fixes the speed problem for dynamic documents. Great!
However, the background now appears black (see attachment). Also, there is
still the speed problem for static documents where no script is added.
creator: neumann@karto.baug.ethz.ch

text:
Created attachment 16580
Another update that fixes black problem and 'inset' problem.

This should fix the major problems with the renderer.  Not clearing areas
outside the
document bounds, and filling with black instead of transparent white.

This still leaves 'dirty bits' behind in some cases when objects are moving
(it happens fairly regularly with the solitare examples).

creator: deweese@apache.org
text: This is now fixed in SVN
